verses.text_plain: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
verses.verse_html:
1A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold. ▼
▼ loving…: or, favour is better than, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ loving…: or, favour is better than, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ loving…: or, favour is better than, etc

verses.text_plain: The rich and poor meet together: the Lord is the maker of them all.
verses.verse_html: 2The rich and poor meet together: the Lord is the maker of them all.

verses.text_plain: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
verses.verse_html: 3A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

verses.text_plain: By humility and the fear of the Lord are riches, and honour, and life.
verses.verse_html:
4By humility and the fear of the Lord are riches, and honour, and life. ▼
▼ By…: or, The reward of humility, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ By…: or, The reward of humility, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ By…: or, The reward of humility, etc

verses.text_plain: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
verses.verse_html: 5Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

verses.text_plain: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
verses.verse_html:
6Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it. ▼
▼ Train…: or, Catechise
 , ▼
▼ in…: Heb. in his way

footnotes.body_html: ▼ in…: Heb. in his way

verses.text_plain: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.verse_html:
7The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender. ▼
▼ the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth

verses.text_plain: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
verses.verse_html:
8He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail. ▼
▼ the rod…: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the rod…: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the rod…: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed

verses.text_plain: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
verses.verse_html:
9He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor. ▼
▼ He that…: Heb. Good of eye

footnotes.body_text: ▼ He that…: Heb. Good of eye
footnotes.body_html: ▼ He that…: Heb. Good of eye

verses.text_plain: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
verses.verse_html: 10Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

verses.text_plain: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
verses.verse_html:
11He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend. ▼
▼ for…: or, and hath grace in his lips

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for…: or, and hath grace in his lips
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for…: or, and hath grace in his lips

verses.text_plain: The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
verses.verse_html:
12The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor. ▼
▼ the words: or, the matters

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the words: or, the matters

verses.text_plain: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
verses.verse_html: 13The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

verses.text_plain: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the Lord shall fall therein.
verses.verse_html: 14The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the Lord shall fall therein.

verses.text_plain: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
verses.verse_html: 15Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

verses.text_plain: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
verses.verse_html: 16He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

verses.text_plain: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
verses.verse_html: 17Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

verses.text_plain: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
verses.verse_html:
18For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips. ▼
▼ within…: Heb. in thy belly

footnotes.body_html: ▼ within…: Heb. in thy belly

verses.text_plain: That thy trust may be in the Lord, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
verses.verse_html:
19That thy trust may be in the Lord, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee. ▼
▼ even…: or, trust thou also

footnotes.body_html: ▼ even…: or, trust thou also

verses.text_plain: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
verses.verse_html: 20Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

verses.text_plain: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
verses.verse_html:
21That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee? ▼
▼ to them…: or, to those that send thee?

tokens.text: That I might make thee know

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to them…: or, to those that send thee?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to them…: or, to those that send thee?

verses.text_plain: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
verses.verse_html: 22Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

verses.text_plain: For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
verses.verse_html: 23For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

verses.text_plain: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
verses.verse_html: 24Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

verses.text_plain: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
verses.verse_html: 25Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

verses.text_plain: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
verses.verse_html: 26Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

verses.text_plain: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
verses.verse_html: 27If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

tokens.text: If thou hast nothing to pay

verses.text_plain: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
verses.verse_html:
28Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set. ▼
▼ landmark: or, bound

verses.text_plain: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
verses.verse_html:
29Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men. ▼
▼ mean…: Heb. obscure men

footnotes.body_html: ▼ mean…: Heb. obscure men
